metadata.title: CVE-2022-34918 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - high
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 5.18.9. A typeconfusion bug in nft_set_elem_init (leading to a buffer overflow) could beused by a local attacker to escalate privileges, a different vulnerabilitythan CVE-2022-32250. (The attacker can obtain root access, but must startwith an unprivileged user namespace to obtain CAP_NET_ADMIN access.) Thiscan be fixed in nft_setelem_parse_data in net/netfilter/nf_tables_api.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-34918` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 6.5.0-9.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 6.5.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-gke - 6.8.0-1003.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 6.5.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 6.5.0-9.9.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-9.9.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 6.5.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 6.5.0-1005.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-oem - 6.8.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-intel - 6.8.0-1001.6
No subscription required
